marytts.tools.newlanguage
Class LTSTrainer

java.lang.Object
  marytts.fst.AlignerTrainer
      marytts.tools.newlanguage.LTSTrainer

public class LTSTrainer
extends AlignerTrainer

This class is a generic approach to predict a phone sequence from a grapheme sequence. the normal sequence of steps is: 1) initialize the trainer with a phone set and a locale 2) read in the lexicon, preserve stress if you like 3) make some alignment iterations (usually 5-10) 4) train the trees and save them in wagon format in a specified directory see main method for an example. Apply the model using TrainedLTS

Author:
benjaminroth

Parameters:
aPhSet - the allophone set to use.
convertToLowercase - whether to convert all graphemes to lowercase, using the locale of the allophone set.
considerStress - indicator if stress is preserved

readLexicon

public void readLexicon(java.io.BufferedReader lexicon,
                        java.lang.String splitPattern)
                 throws java.io.IOException
reads in a lexicon in text format, lines are of the kind: graphemechain | phonechain | otherinformation Stress is optionally preserved, marking the first vowel of a stressed syllable with "1".

Overrides:
readLexicon in class AlignerTrainer
Parameters:
lexicon - reader with lines of lexicon
splitPattern - a regular expression used for identifying the field separator in each line.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
